document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Luiz Fernando M. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.docTitle: Xiruana silarae Oliveira & Brescovit, 2015, new species
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical spider genus Xiruana Brescovit 1997 (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Anyphaeninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical spider genus Xiruana Brescovit 1997 (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Anyphaeninae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material
. Male holotype and female paratype from Usina Hidrelétrica Engenheiro Sérgio Motta, Porto Primavera (
22 ° 31 ' 45 "S
;
52 ° 57 ' 11 "W
), Rosana, São Paulo, Brazil ,
I–II. 2000
, Equipe IBSP leg., deposited in IBSP 29627 .
Etymology . The specific name is a patronymic in honor of Silara Fatima Batista, first author’s wife.

Diagnosis . Males of
Xiruana silarae
n . sp .
resemble those of
X. tetraseta
by the conspicuous projection at the base of the embolus, but differs by having conductor of Anyphaeninae with a serrated border (
Figs 7
A, B) and median tibial apophysis truncated, with a dorso-apical projection (
Figs 7
D–F). Females are readily recognized by the enlarged anterior border of the epigynal plate (
Fig. 7
G).

Description . Male ( IBSP 29627 ). Coloration as in
X. hirsuta
, except by labium and endites darker, tending towards reddish-brown. Total length 8.1 , carapace length 3.5 , width 2.7 . Clypeus height 0.12 . Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.16 , ALE 0.14 , PME 0.14 , PLE 0.14 ; AME–AME 0.04 , AME–ALE 0.04 , PME–PME 0.2 , PME–PLE 0.1 , ALE–PLE 0.03 . Chelicerae 1.75 long, with four promarginal teeth and four retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: Leg I—femur 3.7 / patella 1.5 / tibia 4.4 / metatarsus 3.75 / tarsus 1.7 / total 15.05 ; II— 3.3 / 1.4 / 3.4 / 3.1 / 1.3 / 12.5 ; III— 2.5 / 1.1 / 1.9 / 2.1 / 0.9 / 8.5 ; IV— 3.6 / 1.25 / 3.1 / 3.9 / 1.05 / 12.9 . Leg spination: I—metatarsus p 1 -0-0, r 0-1 -0; II—tibia r 0-1 -0, metatarsus
v 2 - 1
-0, p 1 -0-0, r0; III—tibia p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 ; IV—tibia p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 . Palp: median apophysis with wide base, strongly curved medially (
Fig. 7
C); branches of retrolateral tibial apophysis equal in length, with conical tips (
Figs 7
D–F). Abdomen: length 4.3 , epigastric furrow 0.7 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 2.4 from base of spinnerets.

Female ( IBSP 29627 ). Coloration as in male. Total length 7.6 , carapace length 3.3 , width 2.39 . Clypeus height 0.14 . Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.18 , ALE 0.16 , PME 0.16 , PLE 0.16 ; AME–AME 0.06 , AME–ALE 0.06 , PME–PME 0.26 , PME–PLE 0.18 , ALE–PLE 0.03 . Chelicerae 2.3 long, with four promarginal teeth and six retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: Leg I—femur 3.4 / patella 1.6 / tibia 3.6 / metatarsus 3.1 / tarsus 1.49 / total 13.19 ; II— 3.2 / 1.5 / 3.1 / 2.7 / 1.15 / 11.65 ; III— 2.5 / 1.2 / 1.7 / 2.0/ 0.8 / 8.2 ; IV— 3.5 / 1.4 / 2.93 / 3.7 / 1.0/ 12.53 . Leg spination: I—tibia
v 2 - 2
-0, p0, r0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0, p0, r0; II—tibia
v 2 - 2
-0, p 1 - 1 -0, r0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0, p0, r0; IV—tibia p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 . Abdomen: length 4.2 , epigastric furrow 0.6 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 2.15 from base of spinnerets. Epigynum: spermathecae rounded; copulatory ducts strongly curved medially, fertilization ducts with same length as spermathecae (
Figs 7
G, H).
Variation . Males (n = 10 ): total length 7.35–8.3 ; carapace 3.25–4.2 ; femur I 3.0– 4.3 . Females (n = 10 ): total length 7.6–11.4 ; carapace 2.9–3.62 ; femur I 2.5–3.6 .

Other material examined . BRAZIL , Mato Grosso : Barra do Tapirapé (
10 ° 52 ' 40 "S
;
51 ° 37 ' 58 "W
),
1 ♂
,
5– 19 .XI. 1964
, B. Malkin leg. ( AMNH ); Goiás : Montividiu (
17 ° 26 ' 38 "S
;
51 ° 10 ' 30 "W
), 1 ♀, 2008 , I.M. Bortolin leg. ( IBSP 145394 ); São Paulo : Botucatu (
22 ° 53 '09"S
;
48 ° 26 ' 42 "W
), Usina São Manoel, 1 ♀,
16 .XII. 1986
, I.M.P. Rinaldi; L.C. Forti leg. ( IBSP 165980 ); 1 ♀,
05.XI. 1987
, I.M.P. Rinaldi; L.C. Forti leg. ( IBSP 165981 ); Presidente Epitácio (
21 ° 45 ' 53 "S
;
52 °06' 19 "W
),
1 ♂
, 1 ♀,
20–25 .III. 2001
, J.P. Guadanucci; R. Bertani leg. ( IBSP 38612 );
1 ♂
, 1 ♀,
30 .III. 2001
, R.P. Indicatti; C.A.R. Souza leg. ( IBSP 38376 ); Piracicaba, (
22 ° 43 ' 30 "S
;
47 ° 38 ' 56 "W
),
1 ♂
,
7 .V. 2003
, Prefeitura Municipal de Piracicaba leg. ( IBSP 37869 ); Porto Primavera, Usina Hidrelétrica Engenheiro Sergio Motta (
22 ° 31 ' 45 "S
;
52 ° 57 ' 11 "W
),
7 ♂
, 14 ♀,
I–II. 2000
, Equipe IBSP leg. ( IBSP 29628 );
9 ♂
, 14 ♀,
I–II. 2000
, Equipe IBSP leg. ( IBSP 166396 );
8 ♂
, 16 ♀,
I–II. 2000
, Equipe IBSP leg. ( IBSP 29626 ); São Paulo (
23 ° 32 ' 51 "S
;
46 ° 38 ' 10 "W
), Usina Hidrelétrica de Três Irmãos, 1 ♀,
X. 1990
, M. Costa; C, Bertim leg. ( IBSP 4820 ); Paraná : Santa Helena (
24 ° 51 ' 37 "S
;
54 ° 19 ' 58 "W
), Reserva Biológica de Santa Helena ,
1 ♂
,
12–16 .XI. 1991
, A.B. Bonaldo leg. ( IBSP 165983 ).

Distribution . Midwest, Southeast and South Brazil (
Fig. 16
A).
